intro: Hieracium criniceps, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium criniceps is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often found in regions with mild winters and warm, dry summers.
